value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 01: Welcome and Course Introduction
value.excerpt: In this video, Peter Myers (Microsoft Most Valued Professional - Data Platform, and course developer), Chris Finlan (Principal Program Manager), and special guest Paginated Report Bear (Course Morale Manager) welcome and introduce you to the course, its outline and the course demo scenario.  The Power

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports in a Day - 01: Welcome and Course Introduction

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: #41 Understanding relationships in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: You normally build relationships in Power BI (connect two tables together) so you can work with the data in both tables as if they were a single table.  In this video you will learn how to create relationships, understand what and how to use the advance options and troubleshoot the most common problems.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/-4ybWQSRcOY" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Buckets or Groups with Power Query in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are different ways you can create buckets or groups for your data in Power BI. Patrick shows you how this can be done with Power Query along with a few other options.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/D1LO8syugMA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Help your Power BI report users with an Information Panel
value.excerpt: Do your Power BI users understand your report? Chances are, at least not all of it. Help them out with an information panel to help describe the report and understand all of the capabilities. Adam walks you through how to do it in Power BI Desktop!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yYr_SlG8bpw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Bookmarks, Selections and Toggles
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use bookmarks and selections to create interesting reports to show different aspects of your data. He also shows a very cool way to change between those selections that he picked up from one of his customers.  Bookmarks - https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-desktop-bookmarks/

value.title: Use Microsoft Flow, and other options, to refresh your Power BI dataset
value.excerpt: Adam looks at your refresh options for Power BI datasets. Including Microsoft Flow!   https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/refresh-your-power-bi-dataset-using-microsoft-flow/  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Why Power BI loves a Star Schema
value.excerpt: Are you using a flat table in your Power BI report? You may be missing out! Patrick explores what a STAR SCHEMA is and why you should be using it.  Guidance doc: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/guidance/star-schema  DAX.tips: https://dax.tips/2021/02/15/visualise-your-power-bi-refresh/  📢 Become

value.title: Create a Table in Power BI using Enter Data and How to Edit it
value.excerpt: Sometimes you just need a new table with a few rows or columns to be added to your data model. One option to create that table is to use the Enter Data option in Power BI Desktop. In this article, I’ll explain how you can use it, and also; more important: How to edit the data of that table after creating

value.title: Get started with Power BI Paginated Reports
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to create your first Paginated Report for Power BI, Power BI Report Server or SQL Server Reporting Services.

topItems.title: Getting started with Power BI Paginated Reports (2021)
topItems.excerpt: Not sure what Power BI Paginated Reports are or how to use them? Patrick walks you through and points you to some great resources to get up and running quickly.  Power BI Paginated Reports require either Power BI Premium Per User or Power BI Premium capacity.  Paginated Report In a Day: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/learning-catalog/paginated-reports-online-course
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/XSIbRNXGgPQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters

topItems.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
topItems.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

He shows you how to create sparklines, indicators and conditional formatting within the Paginated Report using Report Builder.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Learn all about Power BI Aggregations
value.excerpt: Power BI aggregations are for more than just large data models! In this series, Patrick looks at the different aspects of Power BI aggregations.

topItems.title: The How and Why of Power BI Aggregations
topItems.excerpt: Learn the how and why Power BI Aggregations can help your data model be more efficient. This video is part of a Power BI Aggregations series.  Aggregations Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-aggregations  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************

value.title: Get data in Power BI
value.excerpt: You will learn how to retrieve data from a wide variety of data sources, including Microsoft Excel, relational databases, and NoSQL data stores. You will also learn how to improve performance while retrieving data.

value.title: Do you need a date table for time intelligence in Power BI? Nope! (Quick Measures)
value.excerpt: Everyone tells you that you need a date table for time intelligence in Power BI. Not so fast! Patrick shows you how you can use quick measures, like year over year, with a quick measure and no date table!  Download Sample: https://guyinacu.be/quickmeasuresample  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Dynamic filtering with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at taking URL filtering to the next level. He shows how to use dynamic filtering with Power BI reports. He also shows a neat trick of setting a link image for Web URL fields.  Filtering in Power BI: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/filter-a-report-with-a-url-query-string-parameter/
